page.title: 10A KNOTTING FARMER (2)
page.content:
The farms are worked by four men using a variety of machines amongst them Ford tractors and Class combines. A Dutch barn and a dry barn are used to store corn. The most hectic time of the year is the last week of July, when everyone works from six a.m. until late at night harvesting 30 to 40 fields.
The farm has been in the family for a few generations, and Mr. Parrish went into the business with his father when he was twenty. There used to be more livestock but gradually the family moved towards almost total arable farming. Now however Mr. Parrish is concerned to keep a reasonable sized flock of mutton sheep and is very interested in developing his Highland cattle herd for beef.
